Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to surgery with or without intraoperative molecular imaging (10:1 ratio).

Participants.evidence: 112 patients with suspected or biopsy-confirmed cancer in the lung scheduled for sublobar pulmonary resection

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to surgery with or without intraoperative molecular imaging

Objective.evidence: The study objective was to determine the clinical utility of pafolacianine

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary end point was the proportion of participants with a clinically significant event

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to surgery with or without intraoperative molecular imaging (10:1 ratio).

Number_Randomised.evidence: 112 patients with suspected or biopsy-confirmed cancer in the lung

Result_Outcome.evidence: In 38 participants, at least 1 event was a margin 10 mm or less from the resected primary nodule (38%, 95% confidence interval, 28.5–48.3)

Harms.evidence: No drug-related serious adverse events occurred.
